div.p: This document is an up-to-date, authoritative specification of all metadata terms maintained by the Dublin Core Metadata Initiative. Included are the fifteen terms of the Dublin Core Metadata Element Set, which have also been published as IETF RFC 5013 [RFC5013], ANSI/NISO Standard Z39.85-2007 [NISOZ3985], and ISO Standard 15836:2009 [ISO15836].
Each term is specified with the following minimal set of attributes:

tr.td: A token appended to the URI of a DCMI namespace to create the URI of the term.
The human-readable label assigned to the term.
The Uniform Resource Identifier used to uniquely identify a term.
A statement that represents the concept and essential nature of the term.
The type of term as described in the DCMI Abstract Model [DCAM].

div.p: Where applicable, the following attributes provide additional information about a term:

tr.td: Additional information about the term or its application.
Authoritative documentation related to the term.
A resource referenced in the Definition or Comment.
A Property of which the described term is a Sub-Property.
A Class of which the described term is a Super-Class.
A Class of which the described term is a Sub-Class.
A Class of which a resource described by the term is an Instance.
A Class of which a value described by the term is an Instance.
An enumerated set of resources (Vocabulary Encoding Scheme) of which the term is a Member.
A Class of which the described term is an instance.
A specific historical description of a term.
A Property to which the described term is equivalent.

div.p: This release of DCMI Metadata Terms reflects changes described more fully in the document "Maintenance changes to DCMI Metadata Terms" [REVISIONS]. Further information about change history is documented in "DCMI Metadata Terms: A complete historical record" [HISTORY]. DCMI maintains a Web page with pointers to known translations of semantic specifications and related DCMI documents [TRANSLATIONS].

tr.td: [DCAM]
